pr_title: [1.2.x] Fix several type-checking issues for langlib functions

timeline.message: Fix langlib method type-checking for rest param/numeric literals
Require type inference for numeric literal only for langlib invocn
Fix cast for langlib func invocation and add tests
Fix pos for invalid vararg and add tests
Fix inherent type check for list updating langlib funcs

timeline.bodyText: getByte is doing a range check every time we call it. I suggest keeping the code as it is.
timeline.author: KRVPerera

replies.author: MaryamZi

timeline.bodyText:
Do we need a cast to "Integer" here and back to byte again?
I wonder whether we miss an overflow error somewhere ?
timeline.author: KRVPerera

replies.bodyText:
A b7a byte[] is represented as a Java byte[].
Everywhere else, a b7a byte is represented by a Java int (values 0 to 255).
So in this particular scenario, when a b7a byte is in a ref value array (which is represented as a Java Object[]), it'll be as a Java Integer, and we can't directly cast it to a Java Byte.
IINM we wouldn't miss anything with this approach since the compiler guarantees that a byte can only have a value in the range 0 to 255. So this Integer will be some value in the range 0 to 255 and there's a direct representation when we do .byteValue() on it (-128 to 127).
replies.author: MaryamZi
